places.name: Jama Masjid, Delhi

location.address: Behind Red Fort, Delhi, 110006

places.info: Jama Masjid, built by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan in 1656, is one of the largest mosques in India and a key historical landmark located in Old Delhi.

extra.scams: Beware of unofficial guides demanding high fees or charging for entry (entry is free, but camera use may have a fee).
extra.safety: Safe during the day with regular crowds; exercise caution with belongings in busy areas.
extra.security: Security checks at entrances; visitors may be frisked and bags inspected.
extra.crowd_review: Very crowded during Fridays, Eid, and festivals; moderate on weekdays.
extra.staff_behavior: Mosque staff are generally helpful but may strictly enforce dress codes and rules.
extra.maintenance: Structure is centuries old but regularly maintained by Waqf Board.
extra.cleanliness: Courtyard generally clean; some litter possible due to heavy crowds.
extra.traffic: Surrounding area (Old Delhi/Chandni Chowk) is congested; best accessed on foot or via metro + rickshaw.
extra.women_safety: Safe during the day in groups; solo women travelers should dress modestly and avoid late evening visits.
extra.network: Mobile networks available; may be patchy in crowded areas.

places.name: Raj Ghat

location.address: Behind Red Fort, Delhi, 110006

places.info: Raj Ghat is the memorial dedicated to Mahatma Gandhi, marking the spot of his cremation on 31 January 1948. It is surrounded by landscaped gardens and visited by dignitaries and tourists alike.

extra.scams: Occasional touts may offer unnecessary guiding services or overpriced souvenirs outside the complex.
extra.safety: Generally safe; well-patrolled and quiet environment.
extra.security: Security screening at the entrance; CISF/Delhi Police presence.
allowed: Footwear in outer gardens (must be removed at the memorial platform)
extra.crowd_review: Peaceful on weekdays; moderate crowds on weekends, national holidays, and Gandhi Jayanti.
extra.staff_behavior: Staff are respectful and maintain decorum of the site.
extra.maintenance: Gardens and memorial platform are well maintained.
extra.cleanliness: Clean and well-kept; dedicated cleaning staff.
extra.traffic: Nearby Ring Road can be busy; parking is available but fills quickly on holidays.
extra.women_safety: Safe during open hours; serene environment suitable for families and solo travelers.

places.name: Gurudwara Sis Ganj Sahib

location.address: Chandni Chowk Rd, Maliwara, Chatta Pratap, Chandni Chowk, New Delhi, Delhi, 110006

places.info: Gurudwara Sis Ganj Sahib, built in 1783, commemorates the martyrdom site of Guru Tegh Bahadur, the ninth Sikh Guru. It is one of the nine historical gurdwaras in Delhi and a key religious and cultural landmark.

extra.scams: Some touts outside may try to sell unnecessary offerings or parking services; entry and langar are always free.
extra.safety: Safe and welcoming environment with continuous flow of devotees.
extra.security: Security checks at the entrance; volunteers and guards on duty.
allowed: Head covering required (scarves provided at entrance)
extra.crowd_review: Busy during mornings, evenings, and Sikh festivals; steady flow of visitors during the day.
extra.staff_behavior: Sevaks (volunteers) are respectful, helpful, and ensure decorum.
extra.cleanliness: Clean despite heavy footfall; langar hall and prayer area are hygienic.
extra.traffic: Located on Chandni Chowk road; high traffic congestion, best accessed by metro + walking/rickshaw.
extra.women_safety: Safe environment for women, families, and solo visitors.
extra.network: Mobile network available but may be patchy due to dense buildings in Chandni Chowk.

places.name: Feroz Shah Kotla Fort

location.address: Balmiki Basti, Vikram Nagar, New Delhi, Delhi, 110002

places.info: Feroz Shah Kotla Fort, built in 1354 by Sultan Feroz Shah Tughlaq, contains ruins of palaces, mosques, and the Ashokan Pillar. It is an important medieval Delhi landmark and part of Tughlaq-era history.

extra.scams: Some touts may pose as guides; verify official guides and ticket counters.
extra.safety: Generally safe during day; some isolated areas may feel deserted, advisable to visit in groups.
extra.security: ASI-managed site with ticketed entry and basic security checks.
extra.crowd_review: Moderately crowded on weekends; peaceful on weekdays. Popular for Thursday evening prayers at the mosque within.
extra.staff_behavior: ASI staff available at entry; guides available for hire.
extra.maintenance: Some structures show signs of age but site is maintained by ASI.
extra.cleanliness: Fairly clean in main areas; some corners may have litter.
extra.traffic: Located near ITO; heavy traffic during office hours. Limited parking available.
extra.women_safety: Safe during visiting hours; avoid isolated corners if alone.
extra.network: Mobile networks generally available, though weaker inside ruins.

places.name: Markets near Red Fort
places.info: An open-air handicrafts market showcasing Indian art, textiles, and regional food stalls. Popular with families and tourists looking for authentic souvenirs.

markets.name: Chandni Chowk
markets.shopping_practices: bargaining expected; very crowded; pickpocket risk

places.name: family fun activity
places.info: If you got bored from redfort you should try these places

activities.name: Red Fort Light & Sound Show
activities.description: Evening sound and light show narrating the history of the fort and Delhi.
activities.family_notes: Bring light snacks and mosquito repellent; seating is outdoors.

activities.name: Jama Masjid Visit
activities.description: India’s largest mosque, a short walk from Red Fort; kids enjoy climbing the minaret for city views.
activities.age_suitability: Children 5+ (minaret climb not for very young kids)
activities.family_notes: Modest clothing required; remove shoes. Minaret climb has steep stairs.

activities.name: Chandni Chowk Rickshaw Ride
activities.description: Cycle rickshaw ride through Chandni Chowk lanes to explore markets, snacks, and sights.
activities.age_suitability: All ages; fun for children but hold tight
activities.family_notes: Best done in morning or evening to avoid crowds and heat.

activities.name: Raj Ghat
activities.description: Mahatma Gandhi’s memorial surrounded by peaceful gardens, about 1.5 km from Red Fort.
activities.family_notes: Calm and green; good for kids to walk and relax.

activities.name: Shankar’s International Dolls Museum
activities.description: Famous collection of 6,000+ dolls from around the world; popular with children.

activities.name: National Rail Museum (slightly farther, Chanakyapuri)
activities.description: Interactive railway history museum with toy train rides for kids.
activities.family_notes: Toy train ride is the highlight for families.

places.name: Museum on 1857 (Swatantrata Sangram Sanghralaya)

location.address: Red Fort, Netaji Subhash Marg, Lal Qila, Chandni Chowk, New Delhi, Delhi, 110006

places.info: Located within the Red Fort complex, this museum highlights the events of the 1857 First War of Independence, showcasing weapons, documents, paintings, and artifacts related to India’s struggle for freedom.

extra.scams: Be cautious of unauthorized guides around Red Fort claiming exclusive museum access.
extra.safety: Safe during visiting hours; standard CISF security within Red Fort premises.
extra.security: Bag checks and security screening at Red Fort entry gates.
extra.crowd_review: Moderately crowded on weekends; quieter than the main Red Fort areas.
extra.staff_behavior: Museum staff are informative and cooperative, often assisting students and tourists.
extra.maintenance: Displays and galleries are reasonably well-maintained by ASI.
extra.cleanliness: Generally clean, though crowd flow can affect cleanliness on busy days.
extra.traffic: Traffic congestion outside Red Fort during peak hours; inside complex movement is smooth.
extra.women_safety: Safe during visiting hours; families and school groups are common visitors.
extra.network: Mobile networks available, though signal may weaken inside some galleries.

places.name: Museum of Illusions, New Delhi

location.address: A Block, A 30-33 1st Floor, Inner Cir, Connaught Place, New Delhi, Delhi 110001

places.info: The Museum of Illusions in Connaught Place features interactive and mind-bending exhibits designed for family entertainment, group visits, and educational experiences.
places.map_link: A Block, A 30-33 1st Floor, Inner Cir, Connaught Place, New Delhi, Delhi 110001

extra.scams: Some visitors report being approached by touts outside Connaught Place offering fake discount tickets. Buy only from the official site or counter.
extra.safety: Safe for families and children; centrally located with good police presence.
extra.security: Bag checks at entry; general mall/complex security available.
prohibited: Food and drinks inside exhibit halls
extra.crowd_review: Gets busy on weekends and school holidays; weekdays are calmer.
extra.staff_behavior: Staff are friendly, guide visitors to interactive exhibits, and often help with photos.
extra.maintenance: Well-maintained interactive exhibits with regular upkeep.
extra.cleanliness: Generally very clean; daily cleaning in public areas.
extra.traffic: Traffic in Connaught Place can be heavy, especially evenings; parking may be limited.
extra.women_safety: Safe environment; families and groups commonly visit.
extra.network: Strong mobile networks; good 4G/5G coverage inside.

places.name: Kranti Mandir – Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose Museum (Red Fort)

location.address: Lal Qila, Chandni Chowk, Delhi, 110006

places.info: Located within Red Fort’s Kranti Mandir complex, this museum is dedicated to Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose and the Indian National Army, showcasing artifacts, photographs, and documents from India’s independence movement.

extra.scams: Beware of unauthorized guides outside Red Fort claiming paid entry to the museum; entry is included with Red Fort ticket.
extra.safety: Safe during visiting hours; CISF guards present throughout the Red Fort complex.
extra.security: Bag checks and metal detectors at Red Fort entry gates.
extra.crowd_review: Moderately crowded on weekends; quieter on weekdays.
extra.staff_behavior: Courteous and informative; often assist school groups and tourists.
extra.maintenance: Exhibits are well-maintained, with regular updates by ASI.
extra.cleanliness: Generally very clean; daily housekeeping in galleries.
extra.traffic: Traffic congestion around Red Fort, especially during evenings and holidays.
extra.women_safety: Safe during visiting hours; families, groups, and students are common visitors.
extra.network: Mobile networks available; may weaken inside thick-walled galleries.

sources: Press releases on Kranti Mandir museums

places.name: Drishyakala Museum (Red Fort)

location.address: Lal Qila, Chandni Chowk, Delhi, 110006

places.info: Drishyakala Museum, a collaboration between the Archaeological Survey of India and DAG, showcases Indian art spanning four centuries, including works of Raja Ravi Varma, Amrita Sher-Gil, and Company paintings.

extra.scams: Avoid unofficial guides outside Red Fort offering special museum access for extra charges.
extra.safety: Safe for visitors; located within Red Fort premises with CISF security.
extra.security: Security checks at Red Fort gates; bag checks and frisking at entry.
extra.crowd_review: Moderate visitor flow; popular with art and culture enthusiasts.
extra.staff_behavior: Friendly and informative; staff often guide visitors through art displays.
extra.maintenance: Well-maintained exhibits and displays curated in partnership with DAG.
extra.cleanliness: Clean galleries and visitor spaces; daily cleaning by staff.
extra.traffic: Traffic congestion around Red Fort main gates; inside movement is smooth.
extra.women_safety: Safe for women visitors; families and school groups are common.
extra.network: Mobile network available; signal may weaken inside some areas.

places.name: Food Street (Under Lal Masjid, Chandni Chowk)

location.address: Under Lal Masjid, 1901, Ajmere Gate Rd, near Chawri Bazar, Lal Kuan Bazar, Chandni Chowk, Delhi, 110006

places.info: Food Street under Lal Masjid is a bustling hub in Chandni Chowk famous for Mughlai delicacies, kebabs, chaats, and North Indian street food, offering a traditional Old Delhi culinary experience.

extra.scams: Watch out for overcharging; confirm prices before ordering.
extra.safety: Crowded but generally safe; pickpocketing can occur in rush hours.
extra.security: Local police patrols nearby; no formal security.
extra.crowd_review: Extremely crowded in the evenings; popular with locals and tourists.
extra.staff_behavior: Vendors are busy but usually welcoming; service is fast-paced.
extra.maintenance: Basic street setup; limited seating arrangements.
extra.cleanliness: Varies; bustling street food environment with limited waste management.
extra.traffic: Very congested area; best reached on foot or rickshaw from Chawri Bazar metro.
extra.women_safety: Safe in groups during the day and early evening; avoid late-night visits due to crowd control issues.
extra.network: Strong mobile signal; crowded network during peak times may slow data.

places.name: Kake Di Hatti

location.address: Church Mission Rd, Cloth Market, Katra Ghel, Khari Baoli, Chandni Chowk, New Delhi, Delhi, 110006

places.info: Kake Di Hatti, established in 1942, is a legendary eatery in Chandni Chowk famous for its oversized naans, creamy curries, and vegetarian Punjabi cuisine. A must-visit for authentic Old Delhi flavors.

extra.scams: No major scams reported, but area is crowded; avoid touts offering to 'reserve tables.'
extra.safety: Safe during the day; exercise caution with wallets and phones in crowded alleys.
extra.security: No formal security; general Old Delhi police patrol presence.
extra.crowd_review: Very popular with locals and tourists; peak hours see long waits.
extra.staff_behavior: Staff are quick and attentive; service is efficient despite rush.
extra.maintenance: Basic seating arrangements; functional and well-kept for a heritage food joint.
extra.cleanliness: Reasonably clean for Chandni Chowk standards; hygiene is maintained but expect crowded conditions.
extra.traffic: Area is heavily congested; best reached on foot or rickshaw from nearby metro stations (Chandni Chowk or Chawri Bazar).
extra.women_safety: Safe in groups; like most of Chandni Chowk, better visited during the day/evening rather than late night.
extra.network: Good mobile coverage; may slow during peak hours due to dense crowds.

places.name: Nand Di Hatti

location.address: 829 Pan Mandi, Sadar Bazaar, Delhi, 110006

places.info: Nand Di Hatti, a legendary outlet in Sadar Bazaar, has been serving its signature chole bhature and North Indian vegetarian delicacies for decades. A must-visit for Old Delhi street food lovers.

extra.scams: Some touts in the area may try to direct tourists to other eateries; stick to the marked shop.
extra.safety: Safe during daytime; bustling local market environment, so stay mindful of belongings.
extra.security: No formal security; police patrols in Sadar Bazaar area.
extra.crowd_review: Extremely popular; expect queues, especially during lunch hours.
extra.staff_behavior: Staff are brisk but friendly; service is fast-paced.
extra.maintenance: Basic old-style eatery; functional but not modern.
extra.cleanliness: Acceptably clean for a traditional bazaar joint, but very busy.
extra.traffic: Sadar Bazaar is highly congested; approach via rickshaw or walking from the nearest metro (Tis Hazari or Chawri Bazar).
extra.women_safety: Safe during the day; recommended to visit in groups due to the crowded market setting.
extra.network: Mobile signal available but may weaken in congested bazaar lanes.

places.name: Giani's Di Hatti

location.address: Bagh Deewar, Katra Ghel, Fatehpuri, Chandni Chowk, Delhi, 110006

places.info: Giani's Di Hatti, established in 1956, is a famous Chandni Chowk dessert shop known for rabri falooda, lassi, ice creams, and traditional North Indian sweets.

extra.scams: Some touts in Chandni Chowk may misdirect tourists to other sweet shops; confirm the shop signage.
extra.safety: Safe during daytime; crowded at peak evening hours.
extra.security: No formal security, but local police presence in Chandni Chowk.
extra.crowd_review: Very busy in the evenings; extremely popular with locals for desserts.
extra.staff_behavior: Staff are efficient; service is quick due to high turnover.
extra.maintenance: Basic old Delhi shopfront; seating is minimal but functional.
extra.cleanliness: Clean for a busy sweet shop, though heavy crowds may affect it during peak hours.
extra.traffic: Surrounding Chandni Chowk lanes are heavily congested; best reached by metro (Chandni Chowk or Chawri Bazar) and walking.
extra.women_safety: Safe during the day and evening; avoid late-night stays as the market quiets down.
extra.network: Mobile networks generally strong in the area.
